message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.LG 

This paper proposes a method for cross-lingual knowledge alignment, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves similarity estimation and co-training, which are common techniques in information retrieval (IR) and artificial intelligence (AI), respectively. Hence, cs.IR and cs.AI are also likely sub-categories. The paper deals with knowledge alignment, which involves aligning entities, relationships, attributes, and values, which are typically stored in databases. Therefore, cs.DB (Databases) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves ML models and strategies, which are typically evaluated using performance metrics. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category.
